customer_name: Laredo Safari and Adventure Park LLC
site_name: Laredo Safari and Adventure Park LLC

citations.narrative:
The record of disposition for seven rabbits was not available at the time of inspection. A facility representative stated the
animals had been transferred off site. These records are necessary to assess care and welfare of animals and allow
tracking of animals being used for regulatory purposes. Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms
which fully and correctly disclose information concerning all animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held,
leased, or otherwise disposed of by that exhibitor. These records shall be held for a minimum of one year after the animal
is dispositioned and made available to APHIS upon request.
Correct by 28 February 2025.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The primary enclosure for the green-winged macaw, Lola, had a large accumulation of dry, hard excrement on a perch
approximately 6 inches by 6 inches. Insufficient cleaning can lead to disease hazards, soiling of birds, insects, pest,
odors, and could promote poor psychological welfare. Excreta must be removed from primary enclosures as often as
necessary to prevent excessive accumulation of feces.
CORRECTION DATE: 03 MARCH 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Madeline Anna, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The record of disposition for seven rabbits was not available at the time of inspection. A facility representative stated the 
animals had been transferred off site. These records are necessary to assess care and welfare of animals and allow 
tracking of animals being used for regulatory purposes. Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms 
which fully and correctly disclose information concerning all animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, 
leased, or otherwise disposed of by that exhibitor. These records shall be held for a minimum of one year after the animal 
is dispositioned and made available to APHIS upon request. 
 
Correct by 28 February 2025. 
3.158(a)(1) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The primary enclosure for the green-winged macaw, Lola, had a large accumulation of dry, hard excrement on a perch 
approximately 6 inches by 6 inches. Insufficient cleaning can lead to disease hazards, soiling of birds, insects, pest, 
odors, and could promote poor psychological welfare. Excreta must be removed from primary enclosures as often as 
necessary to prevent excessive accumulation of feces.  
 
CORRECTION DATE: 03 MARCH 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Madeline Anna, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
